abstract: Many Chinese are skeptical about Pres Xi Jinping's success in his campaign against official corruption; they do not believe self-serving behavior of China's bureaucracy can truly be changed; also say they are convinced once antigraft campaign ends same problems will return.
lead_paragraph: Two years into a far-reaching government campaign against official corruption, many ordinary Chinese remain deeply cynical about whether it can succeed.

byline.contributor: Patrick Zuo and Jess Macy Yu contributed research from Beijing.

snippet: Two years into a far-reaching government campaign against official corruption, many ordinary Chinese remain deeply cynical about whether it can succeed.

keywords.value: Central Commission for Discipline Inspection (Communist Party of China)
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: In China’s Antigraft Campaign, Small Victories and Bigger Doubts
headline.print_headline: In China’s Antigraft Campaign, Small Victories and Bigger Doubts
